result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R. Wulff

records.addlTxt: 3:25 PM This was originally set for MH on behalf of the State.  Mr. Hillestad & I have resolved this matter as well as 22CF19.  A PLQ/WRF has been signed and filed by Mr. Wulff and Mr. Hillestad.  Mr. Wulff will enter a plea to count 1 of a Second Amended Information  948.02(1)(e) Class B felony.  If he pleads, state would move to dismiss counts 2 & 3 in that case 21CF40 and also State would move to dismiss all counts in 22CF19 companion case.  The PLQ sets forth negotiations.    Both parties will ask to delay sentencing and take the plea today.  Court reviews elements of what State is moving to amend count 1 to 948.02(1)(e) with max. penalty; reviews constitutional rights with defendant; felony prohibitions.  Defendant has no questions and have had sufficient time to consider this agreement and is satisfied with Mr. Hillestad's service in this matter.  Atty Hillestad stipulates criminal complaint contains sufficient facts for his plea.  Court finds State has met its burden to victim rights.  To the amended charge with sexual contact or sexual intercourse with child not obtaining the age of 16, defendant pleads no contest.  Court accepts your plea 948.02(1)(e) to count 1 in 21CF40.  DRI count 2 & 3 in 21CF40 and DRI 22CF19 counts 1, 2, 3, 4.  Atty Hillestad requests 6-8 weeks to complete sentencing memorandum.  Bond conditions will continue.  Jury trial removed from calendar.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:45 PM Defendant Michael R. Wulff in court with SPD Attorney, Nicholis Schroeder by video means.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Reviewed complaint, waive reading and he was under 18 at the time of the offenses.  Mr. Hillestad will be appointed to represent him after today.  Mr. Hillestad represents him in 21CF40. Advised of charges/max. penalties and rights.  TLW for PH.  Court finds you knowingly, voluntarily & intelligently WTL for PH.  There is a JT coming up in 21CF40.  Schedule this matter the day of the JT.  Bond conditions already set and include no contact with EAB.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
